Description: Fragment of pottery amphora, echinus-shaped ring foot and small part of body; black glaze on outside of foot; red dipinto on base. Hard, orange clay, bright mica, few light inclusions.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 336)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxii, left, middle)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.127-128, p.129, p.210, p.226, pl.68)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
